meanings.definition: Used as an exclamation to express anger or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Goddams! I can't find my favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: Oh goddams, I forgot my lunch at home.
meanings.sent3: When the ice cream fell on the floor, I shouted goddams in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rainstorm ruined our picnic, and I yelled goddams at the sky.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder made me jump, and I blurted out goddams without thinking.

meanings.definition: To curse or damn someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She goddams the broken computer every time it crashes.
meanings.sent2: He goddams the traffic whenever he's late for work.
meanings.sent3: The magician accidentally goddams his own trick during the performance.
meanings.sent4: The old witch goddams the village well, causing it to run dry.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain goddams the treasure map, believing it to be cursed.
